question: what is the breakdown product formed when one phosphate group is removed from atp
true_answer: adenosine diphosphate ( ADP ) and an inorganic phosphate , orthophosphate ( P )

1. ATP (adenosine triphosphate) is a molecule that consists of an adenosine molecule and three phosphate groups.
2. When one phosphate group is removed from ATP, it forms ADP (adenosine diphosphate).

Answer:
The breakdown product formed when one phosphate group is removed from ATP is ADP (adenosine diphosphate).
